Equip_Keys_Map01_Key02.name: Mine Access Key
Equip_Keys_Map01_Key02.description: Appears to be for one of the mine entrances along the northern edge of Bright Sands.

Equip_Keys_Map01_Key03.name: Tall House Key
Equip_Keys_Map01_Key03.description: A generic keycard, someone drew a house on stilts on the back.

Equip_Keys_Map01_Key04.name: Clean Room Key
Equip_Keys_Map01_Key04.description: Keycard carrying the 'Asclepius Vaccines' logo. And several biohazard warnings... may want to wash your hands.

Equip_Keys_Map01_Key05.name: Archaeologist's Office Key
Equip_Keys_Map01_Key05.description: Decades of swampy grime have eaten away at the keycard's cover, but someone scratched 'SKELETON' onto it with a knife. Hopefully still works.

Equip_Keys_Map01_Key06.name: Storage Room Key
Equip_Keys_Map01_Key06.description: The keycard is pretty scratched up, and might have been part of some creature's meal, but you can still see the words 'Jungle Outpost' at the top.

Equip_Keys_Map01_Key07.name: Base Camp Armory Key
Equip_Keys_Map01_Key07.description: The key is in almost prestine condition. Hopefully so are the contents of the armory it grants access to.

Equip_Keys_Map02_Key01.name: Boss' Office Key
Equip_Keys_Map02_Key01.description: The unmistakable 'STARPORT' logo leaps out from the card. The smaller 'Top Floor Admin' whispers for your attention in pitiful subscript underneath.

Equip_Keys_Map02_Key02.name: Janitor's Key
Equip_Keys_Map02_Key02.description: A janitor's key loop with a single simple key with a cute broom charm attached; it appears to longingly sweep at the floor as it dangles from your hand

Equip_Keys_Map02_Key03.name: Garage Office Key
Equip_Keys_Map02_Key03.description: The keycard has an image of one of those rad looking 6-wheeler trucks printed on it with the text 'Garage Office' alongside it.

Equip_Keys_Map02_Key04.name: Overseer's Office Key
Equip_Keys_Map02_Key04.description: Labeled with 'Nutrion Farms' and is emblazoned the Nutrion Farms logo. It's still covered in a sickly stale pumpkin juice... ew.

Equip_Keys_Map02_Key05.name: Loose House Key
Equip_Keys_Map02_Key05.description: Looks like the key to someone's house. The amount of rust and moss on it seems to imply its origin is somewhere deep in a jungle.

Equip_Keys_Map02_Key06.name: Lab Keycard
Equip_Keys_Map02_Key06.description: A bright white keycard with the telltale livery of Osiris. 'Pinnacle Labs' is laser etched professionally onto it.

Equip_Keys_Map02_Key07.name: Bar Storage Key
Equip_Keys_Map02_Key07.description: A key to The Tipsy Drone attached to a miniature trinket of the namesakes affable drone mascot.

Equip_Keys_Map02_Key08.name: Community Room Key
Equip_Keys_Map02_Key08.description: A key to what was once a more public space

Equip_Keys_Map03_Key01.name: Research Center Office Key
Equip_Keys_Map03_Key01.description: A key to the Osiris Office. Its owner sure won't be missing it...

Equip_Keys_Map02_Key09.name: Overgrown Keycard
Equip_Keys_Map02_Key09.description: A round green logo is barely visible under the muck that's grown over this keycard.

Equip_Keys_Map03_Key02.name: Korolev Quarry Building Key
Equip_Keys_Map03_Key02.description: A Key to the Korolev Quarry's Boss Office. Usually something good stashed away in such places.

Equip_Keys_Map03_Key04_AlienCorridor.name: Progenitor Corridor Key
Equip_Keys_Map03_Key04_AlienCorridor.description: Osiris discovered the schematics for this strange key amongst the Cultist Ritual Items and figured out how to use alien materials to craft it. Not meant for any human locks. ,,, Equip_Keys_Map03_Key04_AlienCorridor_Location,Can be crafted at the Gear Printer in Prospect Station using Tharis Iron and Progenitor Composite.

Equip_Keys_Map03_Key03.name: Korolev Medical Building Key
Equip_Keys_Map03_Key03.description: A Key to the Korolev Surgery Room. There must have been a lot of injuries on the island for Korolev to set one up.

Settings_RestoreDefaults.description: Are you sure you want to restore all settings to default?

EventPopup_Zeal_2020.description: Play the time-limited Zeal Event mode, and grab one of 7 Zeal Crystals each with unique gameplay effects.  EventPopup_Zeal_2020_Description_Separated_1,Play the time-limited Zeal Event mode!

EventPopup_Zeal_2020_Separated_2.description: Grab one of 7 Zeal Crystals each with unique gameplay effects! EventPopup_Zeal_2020_Description_Separated_3,Finish Event Challenges to get Zeal Charms!

EventPopup_Halloween_2020_Separated_1.description: Horror! Terror! Dread!, 1st line of the halloween event listing a few scary terms EventPopup_Halloween_2020_Description_Separated_2,It's spooky season on Fortuna!

EventPopup_Halloween_2020_Separated_3.description: Grab your own Pumpkin Head and collect cauldrons to unlock exclusive rewards!, final line of the halloween event announcing how to play and what rewards you get.  EventPopupText_Halloween_2020_StartTime,26/10, 2 AM CEST

EventPopupText_Winter_2020_1.name: MIRACLE OVER NEPTUNE,name of the event EventPopupText_Winter_2020_Name_2,Miracle

EventPopupText_Winter_2020_3.name: over,separated name of the event EventPopupText_Winter_2020_Name_4,Neptune

Event_Season1Wipe_AlienMeteor.name: Strange Meteor Core
Event_Season1Wipe_AlienMeteor.description: It may have rained down from the sky like other moon fragments, this chunk of rock is unlike anything found before.  There's a rythmic hissing if you listen closely, though instruments don't pick up any sounds...

Faction_FactionScreen_Korolev.description: Korolev Heavy Industries is the largest megacorp in frontier space, with a presence in every market if not an outright monopoly on most. Their kit is brutal: no bells and whistles, it works, hits hard, and takes a beating. ,Faction description on the overview page  Faction_FactionScreen_Osiris_Description,Osiris was built up from the remains of failed and financially unviable R&D firms to perform dangerous and questionable work outside the Artery, where its owner operates under higher legal scrutiny. Osiris kit is cutting edge, geared towards speed and precision.
Faction_FactionScreen_Korolev.name: KOROLEV

Faction_FactionScreen_ICA.description: The Independent Civilian Advisory is the government where there is no government. Its mission is to represent workers and the supporting populace on colonies and stations; further the financial and political interests is just a nice bonus. ICA kit is well rounded, effective for most every situation. ,Faction description on the overview page   Faction_FactionScreen_Korolev_DetailedDescription,
Faction_FactionScreen_ICA.name: ICA

Gadgets_Scanner.name: Directional Scanner
Gadgets_Scanner.description: A simple directional scanner, this device will point out items of interest in the direction it's facing, as well as give a rough estimate on their range. Of note is that it can detect other hostile Prospectors in the area. , Gadgets_Scanner_Lore,The fluctuating energy fields that affect H-C5.09 make most commonly used scanners ineffective, necessitating this specialized version that, while not as accurate as would be desired, does still work.

Gadgets_HealBeam.name: Kheper Revitalizer
Gadgets_HealBeam.description: Fires a beam that can heal allied prospectors and fix friendly mechanical devices. The charge cannister can also be used to heal the operator when injured. , Gadgets_HealBeam_Lore,The Kheper Revitalizer uses a linked-light beam to energize and guide a swarm of nanites to a target; once in proximity these quickly adapt to repair any damage before becoming inert, either becoming part of the repaired structure or turning to dust.

Gadgets_Translocator.name: Recall Teleporter
Gadgets_Translocator.description: Allows the user to set a recall location to which they can teleport to on demand. Useful for those wanting to get out of a difficult situation.
Gadgets_Translocator.lore: Designed to allow for rapid transport of goods in large factories, the Recall Teleporter has been largely deemed unsafe for use with biological matter, due to minuscule but cumulative errors in the copy and recreation process. Of course, Prospectors aren't exactly known for being risk adverse.

Gadgets_LostProspectorTranslocator.name: Lost Prospector's Recall Teleporter
Gadgets_LostProspectorTranslocator.description: A custom Recall Teleporter, will teleport the user to preset locations under certain conditions. , Gadgets_LostProspectorTranslocator_Lore,Modified based on the schematics from Hector, the Lost Prospector. A lot of effort was put into making this device work and take the user to a predefined location.

Generic_Vehicle.description: A simple off-road gravbike capable of quickly carrying a prospector across the surface of Fortuna III.

Generic_ShutdownTitle.description: Game is about to shut down. Please evacuate the planet in {RemainingTime} or all items will be lost

Lobby_PreLobby_FactionList.description: SELECT THE FACTION YOU WANT TO SUPPORT IN THIS MATCH TO EARN THEIR FAVOR!

Login_Banned.description: If you would like to challenge this ban, please contact our Player Support.

Map_01.name: Bright Sands,Name for persistant map MP_Map01_P Map_02_Name,Crescent Falls

Map_03.name: Tharis Island,Name for persistant map MP_AlienCaverns_P  Map_Legend_Evac,Extraction Point

QuestItem_ICAWildlifePhotographerCam.name: Damaged Camera Drone
QuestItem_ICAWildlifePhotographerCam.description: A common drone used by journalists and photographers. Appears to have been in hover mode over its owner until recently.

QuestItem_ICAHowlerData1.name: Security Camera Footage
QuestItem_ICAHowlerData1.description: Data drive from a Korolev security camera. It shows a giant creature viciously attacking a pair of prospectors second after their pods landed. Given your basic knowledge of anatomy, mainly in regards to how many litres of blood an adult has in them, it seems extremely unlikely they survived.

QuestItem_ICAHowlerData2.name: Howler Combat Tips
QuestItem_ICAHowlerData2.description: A collection of 'tips' on avoiding and fighting the creature known as 'Howler'. It warns against moving when the creature 'screams', and to aim for its belly when possible. Avoiding the beast altogether is listed as the best strategy, something the tip-maker failed to do.

QuestItem_KORHowlerEvidence1.name: Howler Dossier
QuestItem_KORHowlerEvidence1.description: A dossier full of old reports and photos that place previous Howler sightings near Korolev mining sites, usually immediately after a blasting or wall breach.

QuestItem_KORHowlerEvidence2.name: Old Howler Data
QuestItem_KORHowlerEvidence2.description: A more detailed report on past Howler sighting Korolev covered. Whether or not Howler appearances were caused by Korolev mining is not confirmed, but at the time the corp certainly believed so, and went out of their way to keep all the data they collected off-network.

QuestItem_OSIHowlerClue1.name: Shredded Armor Panel
QuestItem_OSIHowlerClue1.description: Broken and mangled, with some beast's claw still lodged in it. Few creatures are able to deal this much damage. Osiris will want to analyse this.

QuestItem_OSIHowlerSample1.name: Auditory Organ
QuestItem_OSIHowlerSample1.description: Appears to be the organ the howling beasts use to echolocate targets. You're unsure why this was in one of its nests... perhaps molting? Or part of a grim mating ritual?

QuestItem_ICAAudioDecoysPlan.name: Audio Decoy Schematics
QuestItem_ICAAudioDecoysPlan.description: Schematics for a new kind of non-lethal grenade, aimed at simulating weapons fire.

QuestItem_OSIStrongStimRecipe.name: Med Stims Formula
QuestItem_OSIStrongStimRecipe.description: The recipe required to create stronger med stims. Very few of these components sound safe to ever be near living tissue.

QuestItem_OSIPaleIvySample.name: Flora Sample
QuestItem_OSIPaleIvySample.description: Sample of a flower native to Fortuna III. While this plant could theoretically survive on Bright Sands, it's very unlikely it originated from here.

QuestItem_OSICrystalCaveClue.name: Crystalline Material Research
QuestItem_OSICrystalCaveClue.description: Old Osiris research documents, focussed on a new rare crystaline structure. Likely pilfered from an Osiris research lab or lost in the evacuations, it's unlikely the research would have been carried out at the Favela.

QuestItem_Battery.name: Battery
QuestItem_Battery.description: A letium-based battery that can be used to power various machinery on Fortuna.

QuestItem_LaserDrillBeacon.name: Laser Drill Beacon
QuestItem_LaserDrillBeacon.description: A powerful locator that can be used to call down a Korolev Laser Drill Platform on Extreme Letium Veins.

QuestItem_OilPumpBeacon.name: Oil Pump Beacon
QuestItem_OilPumpBeacon.description: A powerful locator that can be used to call down an ICA NiC pump and refiner on an oil deposit.

QuestItem_AlphaWardenBait.name: Alpha Crusher Bait
QuestItem_AlphaWardenBait.description: Printed using Mutated Biomass, this bait can be used to summon an Alpha Crusher at one of its Feeding Grounds.

QuestItem_OrbitalCannonTarget.name: Orbital Cannon Beacon
QuestItem_OrbitalCannonTarget.description: Used for opening the Elite Crusher Caverns, highly charged Osiris laser gets fired at location of this beacon.

QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier1.name: Data Drive Tier 1
QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier1.description: A data drive. Data can be improved at an Uplink, or the drive exchanged for K-Marks.

QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier2.name: Data Drive Tier 2
QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier2.description: A data drive with some interesting information. Data can be improved at an Uplink, or the drive exchanged for K-Marks.

QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier3.name: Data Drive Tier 3
QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier3.description: A data drive with rare information. Data can be improved at an Uplink, or the drive exchanged for K-Marks.

QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier4.name: Data Drive Tier 4
QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier4.description: A data drive with valuable information. Data can be improved at an Uplink, or the drive exchanged for K-Marks.

QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier5.name: Data Drive Tier 5
QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier5.description: A data drive with highly valuable and unique information. Can be exchanged for K-Marks.

QuestItem_HardDrive_DigSite.name: 'Dig Site' Data Drive
QuestItem_HardDrive_DigSite.description: A data drive carrying information on the Bright Sands Dig Site.

ChalniFeather.name: Chalni Feather
ChalniFeather.description: Material used in a variety of printing and upgrading processes.

VaintarShell.name: Vaintar Shell
VaintarShell.description: Material used in a variety of printing and upgrading processes.

Cadmium.name: Cadmium
Cadmium.description: Found in various mineral veins pushed to the surface by the same process that spawns veltecite, this material is still worth selling at the station.

StormSurgeCrystal.name: Storm Surge Crystal
StormSurgeCrystal.description: Malformed veltecite, created when the Cycle emits a localized spike and excites latent veltecite veins underground into growing at an accelerated rate. It's definitely health hazard, but it's also worth a lot...

MeteorFragment.name: Meteor Fragment
MeteorFragment.description: Rare radioactive crystal, retrieved from debris of Fortuna III's cracked moon. Highly valuable.

MeteorCore.name: Meteor Core
MeteorCore.description: Rare radioactive crystal, retrieved from debris of Fortuna III's cracked moon. Extremely valuable.

Biomass.name: Mutated Biomass
Biomass.description: Fortuna III's hostile creatures are already mutated versions of smaller and less aggressive ancestors, but Cycle Storms push forward rarer latent mutations. Researchers buy this stuff, as do some 'fancy' restaurants.

BlueRunnerEgg.name: Blue Runner Egg
BlueRunnerEgg.description: Blue Runner eggs have a notoriously thick shell, allowing them to only care for the eggs when close to hatching. Can be sold on the station.

AlphaWardenHeart.name: Alpha Crusher Heart
AlphaWardenHeart.description: The heart of an Alpha Crusher, or at least chunks of it, can be used for several almost miraculous medical treatments. It's also a local delicacy, for those with more money than sense.

Brightcap.name: Brightcap Mushroom
Brightcap.description: Good for selling and desired by Osiris for their rare properties. Also tastes good, if prepared properly.

GlowyBrightcap.name: Glowy Brightcap Mushroom
GlowyBrightcap.description: A rare glowy mushroom that can only be harvested during the storm on Fortuna. Highly coveted by Osiris.

Nickel.name: Nickel
Nickel.description: Found in various mineral veins pushed to the surface by the same process that spawns veltecite, this material is still worth mining.

CommonVeltecite.name: Flawed Veltecite
CommonVeltecite.description: While relatively low in value, flawed veltecite is still valuable enough to be worth taking a pickaxe to some rocks.

ArdorShard.name: Cloudy Veltecite
ArdorShard.description: Shards of Cloudy Veltecite are often used for energy storage and generation. Korolev are always looking for any that prospectors can mine.

RareVeltecite.name: Clear Veltecite
RareVeltecite.description: A rare shard of clear Veltecite. Korolev will pay a decent bit of pocket money for any that prospectors uncover with their pickaxes.

EpicVeltecite.name: Pure Veltecite
EpicVeltecite.description: Very rare shard of pure Veltecite torn out of a mineral vein, highly valued by Korolev and others.

GlowingCrystalCoreShard.name: Teratomorphic Crystal Core
GlowingCrystalCoreShard.description: Extracted from a glowing Teratomorphic Crystal, just holding this in your bag gives you an uneasy feeling.

LegendaryVeltecite.name: Veltecite Heart
LegendaryVeltecite.description: The 'heart' of a veltecite vein, from which pure and common veltecite grows out of like roots reaching upwards to the surface. Incredibly rare and highly coveted.

MagneticOre.name: Magnetite
MagneticOre.description: Properly refined and treated, these ores can be used to create powerful magnets used in a variety of printing and upgrading processes.

FocusCrystal.name: Focus Crystal
FocusCrystal.description: Growths of these crystals are common on Fortuna III, valuable on the station for where they're often used in the creation of miniature figures.

Polonium.name: Polonium
Polonium.description: Valuable glowy mineral that can only be mined during an active storm on Fortuna III

PolariumCrystal.name: Polirium Crystal
PolariumCrystal.description: Rare crystal, is of scientific interest and can be sold for K-Marks.

DerelictExplosives.name: Derelict Explosives
DerelictExplosives.description: Fortuna III's settlers took to using explosives to both mold the environment to their liking and get rid of the local pests. Can still be sold on the station, for fireworks of course.

OpticGlass.name: Optic Glass
OpticGlass.description: Perfectly polished, lenses like these often find themselves used more in high-powered cutting machinery than in actual optic equipment.

PowerSource.name: Power Cell
PowerSource.description: Material used in a variety of printing and upgrading processes.

SpareCasing.name: Hardened Metals
SpareCasing.description: Material used in a variety of printing and upgrading processes.

ExoNeedles.name: Howler Needles
ExoNeedles.description: Material used in a variety of printing and upgrading processes.

NeuroToxicGlands.name: Toxic Glands
NeuroToxicGlands.description: The foul smelling sack some creatures use to produce compounds capable of breaking down common synthetic materials, nevermind human flesh.

TitanOre.name: Titan Ore
TitanOre.description: Somewhat common on H-C5 planets, Titan Ore was essential during the initial colonization. Still used in a variety of printing and upgrading processes.

PolymetallicPrefabricate.name: Polymetallic Prefabricate
PolymetallicPrefabricate.description: One of those 'miracle materials', sheets of this stuff is commonly used in the printing of various tools, machinery, and of course, weapons.

AzureTree.name: Azure Tree Bark
AzureTree.description: Azure Trees are found sprinkled around the less shaded areas of Fortuna III, with their bark coveted for artisanal goods.

WinterMaterial_Event_01.name: Singing Spaceman
WinterMaterial_Event_01.description: A jolly little spaceman figurine, themed after the suits used by the crew of the Starlight Song as they assisted in the rescue of Aurora Station over the planet Neptune in 2125.  Models like this would often sing short and happy songs, light up, or even dance around.

UncommonModKit.name: Uncommon Mod Kit
UncommonModKit.description: Uncommon mod kit description FILL IN.

RareModKit.name: Rare Mod Kit
RareModKit.description: Rare mod kit description FILL IN.

EpicModKit.name: Epic Mod Kit
EpicModKit.description: Epic mod kit description FILL IN.

LegendaryModKit.name: Legendary Mod Kit
LegendaryModKit.description: Legendary mod kit description FILL IN.

OldCurrency.name: Old Currency
OldCurrency.description: Currency used on Fortuna III before the evacuations. Still in use by some on Prospect Station.

DataPad.name: Interactive Screen
DataPad.description: Interactive Screens were common among civilians on Fortuna III, used for all sorts of purposes. Cached data and basic components give them some selling value.

MagStab.name: Magnetic Field Stabilizer
MagStab.description: A component necessary for certain weapons with high power usage.

AutoLoader.name: Autoloader
AutoLoader.description: Used for printing a variety of equipment requiring regular charges, such as weapons.

ShockAbsorber.name: Shock Absorber
ShockAbsorber.description: A component used for certain weapons with heavy recoil.

MiniReactor.name: Miniature Reactor
MiniReactor.description: Useful for printing equipment with high power requirements. DO NOT DISASSEMBLE. DO NOT ATTEMPT TO REPAIR. IF DAMAGED, DISPOSE OF AS INSTRUCTED IN FIG-24B.

CPURed.name: Master Unit CPU
CPURed.description: An advanced CPU, ideal for the running of adaptive AI systems or the manipulation of complex energy fields.

CPUBlue.name: Zero Systems CPU
CPUBlue.description: Made for crunching through large datasets, used in several devices that require large amounts of simple calculations.

ShardSlicer.name: Shard Slicer
ShardSlicer.description: A delicate yet powerful machine used for printing certain items.

MultiTool.name: Salvaged CoTEC MultiTool
MultiTool.description: These used to be able print, repair, and manipulate simple machinery and electronics. Might still be useful if repaired or used for parts.

PrintResin.name: Print Resin
PrintResin.description: Can be loaded into most printers to print the base components of almost anything, from rubber ducks to weapon parts.

BallBearings.name: Ball Bearings
BallBearings.description: A simple mechanical component used to print a multitude of machines with moving parts, such as firearms.

GyroScope.name: Gyroscope
GyroScope.description: Helps keep things pointing where they're supposed to be pointing even in the roughest conditions, making it quite useful for printing some weapon components.

HydraulicPiston.name: Hydraulic Piston
HydraulicPiston.description: Useful for printing weapons and beacons. The tech may be hundreds of years old, but if it works, it works.

CompoundSheets.name: Compound Sheets
CompoundSheets.description: Standardized metal and plastic sheets like these are used to print everything from tractors to weapons, so long as you follow the right printing instructions.

Alloys.name: Metallic Alloys
Alloys.description: A collection of metal alloys used as a base material in many items, ready to slot into compatible printers.

CreatureClaw.name: Sharp Claw
CreatureClaw.description: Hard and sharp, claws like these are capable of piercing a prospector's defenses and rip their flesh apart with ease.

CrusherTongue.name: Crusher Tongue
CrusherTongue.description: Tough and slimy, the tongue's secretions have a variety of uses if refined, and the flesh itself is considered a delicacy if prepared correctly.

AlphaCrusherSkull.name: Alpha Crusher Skull
AlphaCrusherSkull.description: It doesn't seem to have any real practical purpose, but this trophy is one of the most desired items Fortuna III produces.

GenericCreatureDrop.name: Spinal Base
GenericCreatureDrop.description: Wanted for several rare materials easily harvested from the spine, as well as for research by those looking into the origins of Fortuna III's hostile creatures.

StormyCreatureDrop.name: Charged Spinal Base
StormyCreatureDrop.description: The base of the spine of a hostile Fortuna III creature affected by the Cycle. Contains some useful materials for various items or research.

HardenedBoneAlloy.name: Hardened Bone Plates
HardenedBoneAlloy.description: Dropped from some of Fortuna III's toughest creatures, can be used for printing certain items after refining.

FlakedLethium.name: Letium Clot
FlakedLethium.description: Solidified mass of Letium, rare and valuable.

OilTank.name: NiC Oil Cannister
OilTank.description: A pressured cannister filled with concentrated Nanite-infused Crude. It reacts to the storm radiation in strange ways.  Almost looks like it's alive, moving and swirling on its own.

PureNickel.name: Altered Nickel
PureNickel.description: Found in various mineral veins pushed to the surface by the same process that spawns veltecite, this ore seems to have been affected by proximity with the rare crystals.

BrittleTitanOre.name: Brittle Titan Ore
BrittleTitanOre.description: Somewhat common on H-C5 planets, Titan Ore was essential during the initial colonization. Still used in a variety of printing and upgrading processes.

PureFocusCrystal.name: Pure Focus Crystal
PureFocusCrystal.description: Growths of these crystals are common on Fortuna III, valuable on the station for where they're often used in the creation of miniature figures.

WaterPlant.name: Waterweed Filament
WaterPlant.description: The pollen filament of a Waterweed, a plant that can only be harvested around water bodies such as lakes or swamps on Fortuna III. The blossoms themselves are worthless, but these Filaments fetch a decent price on Prospect Station.

DesertPlant.name: Dustbloom
DesertPlant.description: This lonely weed grows in open, arid areas on Fortuna III and develops valuable vibrant blossoms when exposed to direct sunlight.

IvyPlant.name: Pale Ivy Blossom
IvyPlant.description: The blossom of Pale Ivy, a strange plant that likes to climb up walls to keep its gorgeous, divinely smelling petals out of the reach of critters and insects.

Alien Fruit.name: Indigenous Fruit
Alien Fruit.description: Tastes delicious, and can be processed to gain some useful chemicals.

Fabrics.name: Textiles
Fabrics.description: Heavy and durable fabrics, useful for printing various items.  You can never get the smell of mildew out of these.

Cables.name: Electronic Cables
Cables.description: A bundle of cables, still in good condition.  Unfortunately not platinum plated, unsuitable for true audio transmission.

Insulation.name: Salvaged Insulation
Insulation.description: Even outside of its intended purpose, the materials still have various uses in item printing.  Yes, it's asbestos.

Copper Wire.name: Copper Wire
Copper Wire.description: Still the best bang for the buck for electric cables, makes for a good and cheap electric conductor.

Smart mesh.name: Smart Mesh
Smart mesh.description: Adaptable material, used for printing various items.  Also a fun art tool!

Circuit Board.name: Circuit Board
Circuit Board.description: An old circuit board, its components can be salvaged and repurposed to build new items.  And now you can put e-waste management on your resume.

Adhesive.name: Resin Gun
Adhesive.description: Multi purpose tool, handy for sticking things together or providing flexible insulation.  The warning label says to not use if you need a warning label.

RadioSpareParts.name: Radio Equipment
RadioSpareParts.description: An old colonial radio transceiver; salvaging these for item printing is cheaper than buying new parts.

Antibiotics.name: Old Medicine
Antibiotics.description: Medicine left behind on the planet, can be processed to make new supplies.  Fortuna's colonists definitely had a lot of pills...

PortableLabEquipmentBox.name: Portable Lab
PortableLabEquipmentBox.description: A full lab in a box, also contains all sorts of specialized equipment and materials that can be repurposed.  Loaded with delicate tools, sensitive software, and no manual.

SamplingDevice.name: Biological Sampler
SamplingDevice.description: A portable device used for collecting biological samples in the field. Can be used to assist with printing delicate items.  This model incorporates a pressure-activated injector as well. Mildly concerning.

AnaestheticsContainers.name: Medical Supplies
AnaestheticsContainers.description: A small crate of miscellaneous medical supplies, has all sorts of chemicals useful for printing new items.  There are A LOT of warning labels here.

ProteinBar.name: Nutritional Bar
ProteinBar.description: Nutrion's flagship product, a full day's meal in a single candy bar.

Jewellery.name: Jewellery
Jewellery.description: A simple and easy way to carry one's riches and memories.  Also very easy to lose during an emergency evacuation.

SampleContainer.name: Sample Container
SampleContainer.description: A sealed self-powered container for exotic alien samples.  Scientists are always putting little things in jars and hoping for the best.

AluminumParts.name: Aluminum Scrap
AluminumParts.description: Mostly aluminum and steel; not the most valuable salvage, but useful for printing.

ForgeIron.name: Tharis Iron
ForgeIron.description: A solid clump of inert ancient nanites fused with iron, along with various other elements trapped within when the mass solidified.

PureForgeIron.name: Pure Tharis Iron
PureForgeIron.description: A small mass of inert nanites mixed with elemental iron and few other metals. The composite structure is almost perfect.

ForgeIronIngot.name: Tharis Iron Ingot
ForgeIronIngot.description: A well shaped ingot made with Tharis Iron. Harder and heavier than anything else you have ever felt. Slightly warm to the touch.

ChargedForgeIronIngot.name: Charged Tharis Iron Ingot
ChargedForgeIronIngot.description: An ingot made of Pure Tharis Iron somehow charged with storm lightning. Sometimes lets off a shock when touched, and you can hear a buzz if you put it next to your ear.  OSIRIS ADVISORY: Do not any under circumstances interact with this material without Class T protective gear!

SuperChargedForgeIronIngot.name: Super Charged Tharis Iron Ingot
SuperChargedForgeIronIngot.description: An ingot made of Pure Tharis Iron, heavily charged with storm lightning. Just touching it leaves your fingers numb.  OSIRIS ADVISORY: Do not any under circumstances interact with this material without Class T protective gear!

StriderHead.name: Strider Head
StriderHead.description: The torn off head of a dead Strider.  Careful, it can still bite!

StriderHead_03.name: Heavy Strider Head
StriderHead_03.description: The torn off head of a dead Heavy Strider.  Far too ugly to mount on a wall.

RattlerHead.name: Rattler Head
RattlerHead.description: The torn off head of a dead Rattler.  Corrosive drool everywhere, handle with gloves.

RattlerHead_02.name: Mature Rattler Head
RattlerHead_02.description: The torn off head of a dead Mature Rattler.  These things do NOT age gracefully...

WeremoleHead.name: Marauder Head
WeremoleHead.description: The torn off head of a dead Marauder.  The eyes still follow you around. Creepy.

WeremoleHead_02.name: Savage Marauder Head
WeremoleHead_02.description: The torn off head of a dead Savage Marauder.  It's still blinking. Menacingly.

CrusherHead.name: Crusher Head
CrusherHead.description: The torn off head of a dead Crusher.  It's even uglier up close... Still, a fine trophy!

StriderMeat.name: Strider Flesh
StriderMeat.description: A chunk of Strider flesh. Presumably of a dead one.  You know, if you cook it properly it's actually pretty good.

StriderMeat_3.name: Heavy Strider Flesh
StriderMeat_3.description: A chunk of flesh from a Heavy Strider.  Tougher than normal Strider meat, it barely bleeds.

RattlerEyes.name: Rattler Eyes
RattlerEyes.description: The eyes of a dead Rattler.  Well, hopefully it was dead, anyway...

RattlerEyes_2.name: Mature Rattler Eyes
RattlerEyes_2.description: The eyes of a dead Mature Rattler.  Age only improved the thing's sight...

WeremoleMeat.name: Marauder Flesh
WeremoleMeat.description: A chunk of Marauder flesh.  It moves if you poke it.

WeremoleMeat_2.name: Savage Marauder Flesh
WeremoleMeat_2.description: A chunk of Savage Marauder flesh.  Burns if you touch it without gloves.

CrusherMeat.name: Crusher Flesh
CrusherMeat.description: A chunk of Crusher flesh.  Even its meat is hard as bone.

RattlerSkin.name: Rattler Skin
RattlerSkin.description: Taken off a skinned Rattler.  Fashionable! Just don't think about where it came from.

CrusherSkin.name: Crusher Hide
CrusherSkin.description: Taken off a skinned Crusher.  (read: hacked repeatedly until something fell off)

AF_Slag.name: Progenitor Slag
AF_Slag.description: Refuse from some unknown process. Not very useful, but still fetches a high price on the station by alien artefact collectors and admirers of rare art.

AF_Token.name: Abyss Alloy
AF_Token.description: A sphere of processed and activated Tharis Iron impossibly locked in place.   Gives an aura of infinite potential.

AlienPlant.name: Spine Briar
AlienPlant.description: A unique plant so far only found on Tharis Island. Nothing about it feels right...

AlienScrap.name: Progenitor Composite
AlienScrap.description: A clearly alien material, the Progenitors built their monuments on Fortuna III with this. Could possibly be used to build other things, as well.

QuestItem_KorolevScrip.name: Korolev Scrip
QuestItem_KorolevScrip.description: Rewarded by Korolev, required for upgrades to your Quarters' Stash and Safe Pockets.

QuestItem_OsirisScrip.name: Osiris Scrip
QuestItem_OsirisScrip.description: Rewarded by Osiris, required for upgrades to your Quarters' K-Mark and Aurum generators.

QuestItem_ICAScrip.name: ICA Scrip
QuestItem_ICAScrip.description: Rewarded by the ICA, required for upgrades to your Quarters' Supply Crate Generator and Gear Printer.

MissionItem_MinerItem1.name: Miner Cam #2F53
MissionItem_MinerItem1.description: Camera belonging to a 'Jamie Faulkner'. The last video file is damaged, but the audio is of a large crowd demanding to be let in' before suddenly cutting off. '

MissionItem_MinerItem2.name: Miner Cam #D027
MissionItem_MinerItem2.description: Owner named only as 'Temporary'. Last video shows several workers running out barricaded buildings and towards a clearing with a guarded ship being loaded with ore. Video cuts off after the owner appears to trip and fall.

MissionItem_MinerItem3.name: Miner Cam #A45D
MissionItem_MinerItem3.description: Camera belonging to a 'Mayumi S. Nagao'. Video shows her being pushed out of a cargo ship by a Korolev Heavy Trooper and falling into the mud. Video cuts off shortly after an eruption of gunfire is heard around her.

MissionItem_EngineerItem.name: Letium Coated Helmet
MissionItem_EngineerItem.description: An engineer's helmet caked in Letium. The embedded sensors may have recorded something important.

MissionItem_CreatureSample.name: Letium Bio Samples
MissionItem_CreatureSample.description: A container preserving... something. A label on the side states: 'WARNING: HIGH LETIUM CONTENT, DO NOT SHAKE'

MissionItem_LaserDrillPart.name: Laser Drill Control Unit
MissionItem_LaserDrillPart.description: Part of the system that manages the Drill. Hopefully it can be reconfigured to safely mine for Letium.

MissionItem_ICAPersonalItem.name: Sign of Life from Stranded Prospector
MissionItem_ICAPersonalItem.description: A photo of Marie and a prospector named Tao. Rare to see paper photographs anymore, it must have meant a lot to the owner.

MissionItem_PowerPlantItem1.name: Notes on Meteor Experiment - 1
MissionItem_PowerPlantItem1.description: Personal data tablet with theoretical research on powering energy generators with fragments from Fortuna's moon. The power output of a single working 'Fireball generator would be revolutionary. '

MissionItem_PowerPlantItem2.name: Notes on Meteor Experiment - 2
MissionItem_PowerPlantItem2.description: Data on the first prototype for 'Project Fireball'. Yields under safe conditions were underwhelming, with warnings of an uncontrollable chain reaction if pushed too hard without further research. Might explain why there's a giant hole in the moon...  Final notes suggest switching resources to look into 'NiC'.

MissionItem_OilPumpPart.name: Oil Pump Part
MissionItem_OilPumpPart.description: One of the few remaining components from an old oil pump that still looks to be in working condition.

MissionItem_OldBones.name: Old Bones
MissionItem_OldBones.description: Belonging to a long dead creature, damage has exposed metalic elements that seemed to have formed after death.

MissionItem_AlphaSkull.name: Warden Tooth
MissionItem_AlphaSkull.description: The tooth of a now extinct massive beast once common on Fortuna III. Parts of it seem to have unnatural grooves and geometric shapes.

MissionItem_FlightRecorder.name: Flight Recorder
MissionItem_FlightRecorder.description: A cargo ship's flight recorder, only slightly damaged. Highly encrypted and beyond your suit's ability to access.

MissionItem_Notebook.name: Old Notebook
MissionItem_Notebook.description: An Osiris researcher's notebook. It's seen better days. Full of formulas, drawings, and long paragraphs regarding the unnatural evolution and mutations of Fortuna III's fauna caused by Progenitor terraformers.

MissionItem_KorChiefEngineerDiary.name: Chief Engineer's Personal Diary
MissionItem_KorChiefEngineerDiary.description: An off the record log of some of the events that occurred on Tharis island. While badly damaged, and much of it is in short hand, what's evident is Korolev ran into serious issues in the caverns: several reports of miners going missing, pervasive malaise, multiple accidents...  The operation's foreman clearly had little regard for workplace safety.

MissionItem_ForgeIronSample.name: Tharis Iron Sample
MissionItem_ForgeIronSample.description: A collected sample of a rare composite material found in the Tharis Caverns

MissionItem_PureForgeIronNugget.name: Pure Tharis Iron Nugget
MissionItem_PureForgeIronNugget.description: A tagged nugget of a rare composite material found in the Tharis Caverns. Denser and with next to no impurities than most samples.

MissionItem_MiningPartyMedicalFiles.name: Mining Party Medical Files
MissionItem_MiningPartyMedicalFiles.description: A collection of medical reports from the Korolev team working the caverns. Initial incidents involved exhaustion and minor injuries, but later reports focus on mental clouding, hallucinations, loss of time...  Symptoms appear identical to those of prolonged exposure to the Teratomorphic Energy Field that now envelops most of Fortuna III.

MissionItem_VadimPredecessorItem.name: The Tharis Files
MissionItem_VadimPredecessorItem.description: A folder kept by Gregor Kazan, the Head of Operations for Korolev when the storms hit Fortuna III decades ago. It appears he intentionally kept all reports and findings from the Tharis operations off the system, though the reason for that isn't explained, nor is how the folder ended up on the island.  Worryingly, official records state less than 50 Korolev employees ever worked in the caverns, while these files list several hundred.

MissionItem_StolenKorData1.name: Korolev Data Drive #473-D
MissionItem_StolenKorData1.description: A chunky old data drive. Might have some valuable info, if it still works.

MissionItem_StolenKorData2.name: Korolev Notes
MissionItem_StolenKorData2.description: A Korolev data drive. Appears to have been used as a blunt instrument. Has definitely seen better days.

MissionItem_CultistGlowCrystalItem.name: Mysterious Glowing Contraption
MissionItem_CultistGlowCrystalItem.description: A crystaline chunk with various cables and circuit boards haphazardly strapped on to it.  It's impossible to tell if the mind that created this had something utilitarian in mind, or if this creation is simply a form of religious 'art'.

MissionItem_CultistRitualItem.name: Cultist Ritual Item
MissionItem_CultistRitualItem.description: Some sort of cultist fetish, featuring a clump of Tharis Iron and a sigil or diagram of some kind. Maybe they venerated the alien material? Or it's just a symbol for the caverns themselves?

MissionItem_AlienShieldRecipe.name: Cultist Scribblings
MissionItem_AlienShieldRecipe.description: An old sheet of paper with various drawings and pictograms laid out as simple formulas, all but one scratched out.  The same trident-like drawing found on previous cultist items features prominently here.

MissionItem_ColonistItem.name: Colonist Item
MissionItem_ColonistItem.description: An old mini-comm and some personal items. Whoever this belonged to likely didn't work on the island.

MissionItem_StolenOsiHoloMap.name: Tharis Caverns Holo-Map
MissionItem_StolenOsiHoloMap.description: A map liberated from an abandoned Osiris outpost. Shows the layout of the Tharis caverns, including several areas marked as high-interest.

MissionItem_KorCivilianItem.name: Vintage Camera
MissionItem_KorCivilianItem.description: An ancient video recording device, probably fashionable in some retro circles. Amazingly it actually powered on, though only for a few seconds.

MissionItem_AlienDoorFragment.name: Osiris Door Fragment
MissionItem_AlienDoorFragment.description: A loose bit from the strange door in one of the Osiris installations on Tharis Island.  The door itself seems impenetrable, far more robust than what Osiris is known for building.

MissionItem_AnalysisTool.name: Advanced Analysis Toolkit
MissionItem_AnalysisTool.description: An old Osiris portable lab, still in working condition. Surely nobody will mind giving it a new home and purpose...

MissionItem_OsiChiefEngineerItem.name: Osiris Engineer Scanner
MissionItem_OsiChiefEngineerItem.description: Recovered off the body of an Osiris engineer in Tharis Caverns, appears to have been mapping out potential research locations when they met with a terrible fate.

MissionItem_OsiHeadScientistItem.name: Osiris Helmet Recorder
MissionItem_OsiHeadScientistItem.description: A damaged Osiris researcher helmet, these always carry their own camera and data storage.  Fortunately, whatever it was that did short work of its wearer managed to avoid breaking any of the valuable bits.

Event_StormDiversFlyer.name: Storm Divers Commission
Event_StormDiversFlyer.description: Official document issued to prospectors that drop onto Crescent Falls or Tharis Island as a Storm Diver. Required to hand in to the factions for certain missions as proof of participation.  Warning: Storms on Crescent Falls and Tharis Island have a dramatically increased frequency and intensity. Use extreme caution when dropping to these areas, and don't hesitate to make use of the gear granted by the factions in crates placed around your drop pod.

Event_MeteorCore.name: Altered Meteor Core
Event_MeteorCore.description: Core of a meteor from Fortuna III's cracked moon. Its path through the strange storms over the planet have altered it somehow.  Can be used for printing high-tier gear.

Event_MeteorFragment.name: Altered Meteor Fragment
Event_MeteorFragment.description: Fragment of a meteor from Fortuna III's cracked moon. Its path through the strange storms over the planet have altered it somehow.  Can be used at the gear printer. Multiple Fragments can be used to create an Altered Meteor Core.

Event_StormdiversHowlerSpike.name: Spike from an Unknown Creature
Event_StormdiversHowlerSpike.description: A very dangerous-looking Spike, left behind by a strange new Creature that seems to have appeared on Fortuna. Be on your guard.

AI_HowlerDart.name: Howler Dart
AI_HowlerDart.description: One of the deadly projectiles Howlers use to skewer prey from a distance. This one was still not fully formed and can be harvested for useful materials. Worth some coin to the right people. , Material_AI_HowlerDart_Location,Occasionally dropped by dead Howlers.

AI_HowlerGland_01.name: Howler Ichor Gland
AI_HowlerGland_01.description: A damaged gland ripped out of a dead Howler. Used by the creatures to excrete several compounds and pheromones, commonly referred to as 'honey'; the organ alone is in high demand. , Material_AI_HowlerGland_01_Location,Can sometimes be found on dead Howlers.

AI_HowlerGland_02.name: Inflamed Howler Ichor Gland
AI_HowlerGland_02.description: Known as the 'Honey Gland, this organ is still capable of producing someo of the valued honey-like substance Howlers use to attract and dominate other creatures. Very valuable. , Material_AI_HowlerGland_02_Location,Can be ripped out of of dead Howlers, if you're lucky.

AI_HowlerSyrinx_01.name: Damaged Howler Syrinx
AI_HowlerSyrinx_01.description: Effectively the 'vocal cords' that Howlers use to emit their iconic screams. Reaches a high price on the station. , Material_AI_HowlerSyrinx_01_Location,Rarely dropped by dead Howlers.

AI_HowlerSyrinx_02.name: Intact Howler Syrinx
AI_HowlerSyrinx_02.description: The sound emitting organ of a dead Howler, removed in one whole neat piece. The intricacies of its 'construction' make it very valuable. , Material_AI_HowlerSyrinx_02_Location,Very rarey found on dead Howlers.

AI_HowlerPellet.name: Howler Ichor Bulb
AI_HowlerPellet.description: An encased glob of Howler 'honey', the sticky substance the creatures use to affect other creatures, and as sustenance for their young. It's been found to be highly nutritious, sweet, and have almost mythical regenerative properties. Of course, it's also extremely addictive with a lethal withdrawal. , Material_AI_HowlerPellet_Location,Can be found in Howler nests.

MS_Onboarding_Intro_Insurance_Intro.name: Insurance MS_Onboarding_Intro_Insurance_Intro_01,Apply <B1>Standard Insurance</> to one or more of your items.

MS_Onboarding_Intro_FreeLoadouts.name: Free Loadouts MS_Onboarding_Intro_FreeLoadouts_01,Free loadouts contain randomized gear and are available in certain time intervals.

Mod_Korolev_Scanner_HeavyMetals.name: Titan Ore Scanning Module, Mod_Korolev_Scanner_HeavyMetals_Description,Scanners equipped with this Attachment can highlight Titan Ore and Brittle Titan Ore while scanning.

Mod_Korolev_Scanner_Veltecite.name: Veltecite Scanning Module, Mod_Korolev_Scanner_Veltecite_Description,Scanners equipped with this Attachment can highlight Veltecite while scanning.

Mod_Korolev_Scanner_Oil.name: Crude Oil Scanning Module, Mod_Korolev_Scanner_Oil_Description,Scanners equipped with this Attachment can highlight active Crude Oil Wells while scanning.

Shop_Offer_StarterPack2022_1.name: Initiate Pack
Shop_Offer_StarterPack2022_1.description: New to Fortuna III? This Welcome Pack will give you a head start; with a unique outfit and weapon skin, some gear to get you started, plus a fistful of Aurum, you'll fit right in!

Shop_Offer_StarterPack2022_2.name: Professional Pack
Shop_Offer_StarterPack2022_2.description: An unprepared Prospector won't last long on Fortuna III, so give yourself some love with this Welcome Pack, netting you two unique outfits, unique weapon skins, a fair amount of Aurum, and a good bit of extra kit! What's not to like?

Shop_Offer_StarterPack2022_3.name: Specialist Pack
Shop_Offer_StarterPack2022_3.description: Want to show off your skills? With this Welcome Pack you'll be ready for anything Fortuna III throws at you! You'll get three unique outfits, unique weapon skins, and enough Aurum and gear to keep you fighting!

Shop_Offer_StarterPack2022_4.name: Elite Pack
Shop_Offer_StarterPack2022_4.description: The best Prospectors always come prepared, and with this ultimate Welcome Pack you'll be sure to thrive! You get four unique outfits, a premium Jumpsuit variant, unique weapon skins, plus a mountain of Aurum and gear!

Shop_Offer_PrimeTimePack2022.name: Prime Time!
Shop_Offer_PrimeTimePack2022.description: Get ready for the limelight! The Prime Time pack is here with one of Fortuna III's most striking prospectors, along with an assortment of dazzling masks fit for any occasion!

Shop_Archetype_S03_JungleBandit.name: Jungle Bandit
Shop_Archetype_S03_JungleBandit.description: More comfortable in the dense forests of Fortuna III than the crowded walkways of Prospect Station, this dedicated hunter yearns to eradicate the Howler threat and return to his natural habitat.

Shop_Archetype_S03_AuthorityOperative.name: Authority Operative
Shop_Archetype_S03_AuthorityOperative.description: Without any communication with HQ, and without pay, even the Authority's commandos need to earn a living. Where better to put their skills to use than the planet's hellish surface?

Shop_Archetype_S03_UnboundSynth.name: Unbound Synth
Shop_Archetype_S03_UnboundSynth.description: A human brain animates this synthetic body, now freed from their decades-long 'work contract'. But maintaining a work of art and engineering like this isn't cheap, and out here nothing pays better than prospecting. The grind never ends.

Shop_Archetype_S03_Harvester.name: Harvester
Shop_Archetype_S03_Harvester.description: A body ravished by an illness from the surface, only materials obtained from the surface can keep this husk alive, and maybe even heal them. A strong sense of independence, or just stubborn arrogance, drives the Harvester to collect these materials himself.

Shop_Archetype_S03_Bloodhound.name: Bloodhound
Shop_Archetype_S03_Bloodhound.description: The Bloodhound can always smell a good story, and Fortuna III is teeming with good stories, especially of the morbid and violent kind. The only way to reach the surface is to become an independent prospector or a corporate drone; a non-choice, really.

Shop_Archetype_S03_TheArtillery.name: The Artillery
Shop_Archetype_S03_TheArtillery.description: Military-grade prosthetics seemed like a small reward for the sacrifices of battle, but they've sure come in 'handy'. Now when the station's underground czars need the big guns to 'solve' a problem, they call in The Artillery. And on their days off, some prospecting helps to pass the time and clear the mind.

Station_ScreenText_Badum.description: Acts as the intermediary between the station, factions, and prospectors, but more importantly runs the local bar,, Station_ScreenText_Badum_Intro,Hey Prospector, nice to have you here. These days everyone is trying to scavenge whatever they can get from the planet. But I have a soft sport for young bloods like you. So here's some gear for you to start with, use it wisely! Whatever you lose on Fortuna III is gone for good, the storm will make sure of that. Now, go check out the rest of the station!

Station_TechTree_2.description: Life on Fortuna III is tough, but that doesn't need to carry to Prospect Station!  Crafting Quarters upgrades will allow you to improve your inventory sizes, printing speeds, and even generate daily income and supplies. Upgrade each path to unlock new Quarter levels and access even more improvements!

Station_TechTree_Inventory.description: Increase the capacity of your Stash in the Station, and your Safe Pockets in your loadout. ,, Station_TechTree_Generators_Description,Unlock and improve daily generation of K-Marks, Aurum, and Supply Crates.

Station_RetentionBonus.description: Receive a new item based on the days you login (up to {amount} days) Items are automatically added to your Inventory.

WP_Shared_Scrappy.description: It has outlived it's glory days.

WP_A_AR_Bullet_01.name: KOR-47
WP_A_AR_Bullet_01.description: Heavy assault rifle. Lower rate of fire than others in its class, but packs a punch. Audible range: 400m
WP_A_AR_Bullet_01.lore: The KOR Bullpup Automatic Rifle 2247, more commonly known as the KOR-47, is Korolev Heavy Industries' signature weapon and a mainstay of many national and private armed forces.

WP_G_Pistol_Energy_01.name: Scarab
WP_G_Pistol_Energy_01.description: A dependable pistol, fires in controlled and powerful three-shot bursts. Audible range: 300m
WP_G_Pistol_Energy_01.lore: The Scarab, an Adaptive Phase Pistol, is one of Osiris' most successful weapons, able to induce a localized rapid matter state change on remote targets at a fraction of the energy cost of more conventional laser-based weaponry. With energy efficiency and safety in mind, the Scarab is a solid choice of sidearm, though its compact form limits the extent of its lethality.

WP_G_Pistol_Energy_02.name: Scarab - Mk.II
WP_G_Pistol_Energy_02.description: An improved version of the standard Scarab Adaptive Phase Pistol, custom built for the Osiris Harbinger Expeditionary Corps. A rare find, worth keeping hold of. Audible range: 300m
WP_G_Pistol_Energy_02.lore: The Scarab, an Adaptive Phase Pistol, is one of Osiris' most successful weapons, able to induce a localized rapid matter state change on remote targets at a fraction of the energy cost of more conventional laser-based weaponry. With energy efficiency and safety in mind, the Scarab is a solid choice of sidearm, though its compact form limits the extent of its lethality.

WP_G_SMG_Needle_01.name: Asp Flechette Gun
WP_G_SMG_Needle_01.description: Lightweight SMG. A formidable automatic weapon for close range encounters. Audible range: 350m
WP_G_SMG_Needle_01.lore: Intended for use by law enforcement in pressurized environments, this weapons' flechettes provide lethal stopping power, can easily defeat light armor, and are designed to prevent overpenetration; a risk in any environment, but disastrous on ships and stations.

WP_G_SMG_Needle_02.name: Asp Flechette Gun - Mk.I
WP_G_SMG_Needle_02.description: A civilian security issue Asp. Not as powerful as the standard Osiris version, it's still a competent SMG.  Audible range: 350m
WP_G_SMG_Needle_02.lore: Intended for use by law enforcement in pressurized environments, this weapons' flechettes provide lethal stopping power, can easily defeat light armor, and are designed to prevent overpenetration; a risk in any environment, but disastrous on ships and stations.

WP_D_Sniper_Gauss_01.name: Kinetic Arbiter
WP_D_Sniper_Gauss_01.description: A gauss sniper rifle that fires metal rods at immense velocity. Favored among Prospectors that want to resolve issues quickly quickly and from a safe distance. Audible range: 500m
WP_D_Sniper_Gauss_01.lore: One of The ICA's most advanced conventional weapons, the Kinetic Arbiter is little more than a military-grade gauss gun stripped down to its most basic components needed to function, without any of the the fancy fittings or safety mechanisms.

WP_A_HVY_Shell_01.name: KARLA
WP_A_HVY_Shell_01.description: While able to neutralize heavily armored targets, the KARLA howitzer is unwieldy and suffers from a low rate of fire. , Weapons_WP_A_HVY_Shell_01_Lore,The Korolev Anti-material Repeating Light Artillery, or KARLA, was originally intended as a vehicle-mounted weapon, but advanced recoil management allowed Korolev to produce a portable version for use without a warsuit.

WP_D_SGun_Shard_01.name: Shattergun
WP_D_SGun_Shard_01.description: An unconventional shotgun that fires shard fragments by shattering an unstable fuel crystal. Audible range: 350m
WP_D_SGun_Shard_01.lore: Crafted on Prospect station using salvage and wood from the planet itself, this scattergun demonstrates The ICA's ingenuity and ability to thrive with limited resources. A molded adrentite crystal, byproduct of its refinement for use as rocket fuel, serves as both projectile and propellant; a small electric charge incites a rearrangement in the crystal's lattice, with the sudden energy release fracturing the crystal into thin shards along its length as they're shot through the barrel.

WP_G_AR_Energy_01.name: Phasic Lancer
WP_G_AR_Energy_01.description: A burst rifle that fires in accurate 3-shot bursts, effective against most threats a Prospector might encounter. Audible range: 400m
WP_G_AR_Energy_01.lore: After the success of the Adaptive Phase Pistol, Osiris thought to develop a weapon platform of more interest to the military market. While this new powered-up weapon can handle significantly more energy than its smaller cousin, Osiris has yet to solve the problem of overheating in full-auto firing mode, or the high risk of carrier-shield leakage when in charged mode.

WP_A_Pistol_Bullet_01.name: Hammer
WP_A_Pistol_Bullet_01.description: A heavy pistol that can inflict devastating damage, at the cost of any kind of subtlety. Audible range: 400m
WP_A_Pistol_Bullet_01.lore: Based on their ubiquitous rivet guns, also known as 'energy hammers', the 'Hammer' was an attempt at developing a low cost personal defense weapon. Popular among those wanting a dependable high-powered pistol, its weight and complex operation make it unattractive to the mass market.

WP_A_Pistol_Bullet_02.name: Hammer - Mk.I
WP_A_Pistol_Bullet_02.description: An older version of the Hammer, popular among colonists before the storms. Packs less of a punch, but still a beast. Audible range: 400m
WP_A_Pistol_Bullet_02.lore: Based on their ubiquitous rivet guns, also known as 'energy hammers', the 'Hammer' was an attempt at developing a low cost personal defense weapon. Popular among those wanting a dependable high-powered pistol, its weight and complex operation make it unattractive to the mass market.

WP_D_Pistol_Bullet_01.name: Bulldog
WP_D_Pistol_Bullet_01.description: A powerful shotgun pistol that suffers from very limited range. Audible range: 300m
WP_D_Pistol_Bullet_01.lore: Simple and effective, compact firearms utilizing shotgun shells are popular on stations as close range problem solvers for their high damage as well as for mitigating the risk of overpenetration that more conventional pistols carry. The Bulldog is the ICA's prefered design, easy to build and maintain, and even easier to operate.

WP_D_AR_Bullet_01.name: Advocate
WP_D_AR_Bullet_01.description: A dependable assault rifle that offers a good balance between accuracy and rate of fire. Audible range: 400m
WP_D_AR_Bullet_01.lore: Based on the SAR-62 carbine used by the Federation itself, the ICA 'Advocate' has only a few deviations from the original design, meant to allow for its manufacture in environments of relative scarcity.

WP_G_HVY_Beam_01.name: Zeus Beam
WP_G_HVY_Beam_01.description: Called 'Zeus' for turning any mortal into the God of Lightning, it can fulminate any creature that meets your divine ire. Audible range: 350m
WP_G_HVY_Beam_01.lore: While beam based weapons have found heavy use on warships for centuries, only in recent years has technology allowed for a portable form factor. These weapons use a linked-light beam to contain and focus a jet of plasma accross great distances, with a fairly predictable effect on whatever it contacts.

WP_G_HVY_Beam_02.name: Zeus Beam - Mk.I
WP_G_HVY_Beam_02.description: An older prototype version of the mighty Zeus. Still capable of fulminating most targets. Audible range: 350m
WP_G_HVY_Beam_02.lore: While beam based weapons have found heavy use on warships for centuries, only in recent years has technology allowed for a portable form factor. These weapons use a linked-light beam to contain and focus a jet of plasma accross great distances, with a fairly predictable effect on whatever it contacts.

WP_A_Launch_MSL_01.name: KOMRAD
WP_A_Launch_MSL_01.description: This fearsome weapon is fires salvos of fast-moving missiles capable of making short work of near any hostile element. Audible range: 500m
WP_A_Launch_MSL_01.lore: Short for Korolev Ozone-powered Micro Rocket Assault Device, the KOMRAD is one of the most destructive weapon systems developed by the megacorp, and one of its most expensive.

WP_E_Pistol_Bullet_01_Scrappy.name: Rusty K-28
WP_E_Pistol_Bullet_01_Scrappy.description: An old rusty semi-automatic pistol. Its glory days are over. Audible range: 300m

WP_E_Sniper_Bullet_01.name: C-32 Bolt Action
WP_E_Sniper_Bullet_01.description: Bolt action sniper rifle that was commonly used by colonists. Accurate and dependable. Audible range: 500m
WP_E_Sniper_Bullet_01.lore: Anachronistic by design, this CoTEC bolt action rifle was meant for civilian use in frontier planets to manage hostile wildlife. Effective in its purpose, the massive increase in wildlife hostility and numbers lead to mass production of lower grade rifles like this one.

WP_E_Sniper_Bullet_02.name: C-32 Bolt Action - Mk.II
WP_E_Sniper_Bullet_02.description: A more powerful variant of the C-32 used by Sentinels to keep the peace outside the old settled areas.  Audible range: 500m
WP_E_Sniper_Bullet_02.lore: Anachronistic by design, this CoTEC bolt action rifle was meant for civilian use in frontier planets to manage hostile wildlife. Effective in its purpose, the massive increase in wildlife hostility and numbers lead to mass production of lower grade rifles like this one.

WP_E_SMG_Bullet_01.name: S-576 PDW
WP_E_SMG_Bullet_01.description: A popular SMG with high rate of fire, formidable at close range. Audible range: 350m
WP_E_SMG_Bullet_01.lore: The CoTEC S-576 is one of the standard firearms used aboard Federation ships, stations, and outposts. Lightweight, compact, and produced in mass by various manufacturers, this model is a staple in practically every weapons market. This model doesn't look quite right, but it still gets the job done.

WP_E_SMG_Bullet_02.name: S-576 PDW - Mk.II
WP_E_SMG_Bullet_02.description: An improved version of the S-576, meant for use by colony security forces before the surface was abandoned.  Audible range: 350m
WP_E_SMG_Bullet_02.lore: The CoTEC S-576 is one of the standard firearms used aboard Federation ships, stations, and outposts. Lightweight, compact, and produced in mass by various manufacturers, this model is a staple in practically every weapons market. This model doesn't look quite right, but it still gets the job done.

WP_E_SMG_Bullet_01_Scrappy.name: Rusty S-576 PDW
WP_E_SMG_Bullet_01_Scrappy.description: A rusty used SMG with high rate of fire, still has some worth in close range engagements. Audible range: 350m

WP_E_Pistol_Bullet_01.name: K-28
WP_E_Pistol_Bullet_01.description: A standard semi-automatic pistol. An effective sidearm for any Prospector. Audible range: 300m
WP_E_Pistol_Bullet_01.lore: With a design that's seen no change in over two centuries, the CoTEC K-28 is one of the most popular weapons throughout known space, as are its many knock offs.

WP_A_BR_Bullet_01.name: KBR Longshot
WP_A_BR_Bullet_01.description: A marksman rifle with good accuracy and power. Excels in medium range engagements. Audible range: 450m
WP_A_BR_Bullet_01.lore: The predecessor to the KOR-47, the Longshot was developed for the Federation to serve as a long range support weapon for ground troops. Designed with a low unit cost in mind, Korolev opted to ensure high accuracy and power over developing a fully automatic weapon.

WP_A_BR_Bullet_02.name: KBR Longshot - Mk.I
WP_A_BR_Bullet_02.description: And older version of the KBR used by Korolev's on-site security forces. Audible range: 450m
WP_A_BR_Bullet_02.lore: The predecessor to the KOR-47, the Longshot was developed for the Federation to serve as a long range support weapon for ground troops. Designed with a low unit cost in mind, Korolev opted to ensure high accuracy and power over developing a fully automatic weapon.

WP_D_BR_Shard_01.name: Lacerator
WP_D_BR_Shard_01.description: A capable marksman rifle, has a decent fire rate, accuracy, and good handling. Audible range: 450m
WP_D_BR_Shard_01.lore: Building upon the the ICA's own Shattergun, this battle rifle is tuned to discharge the crystaline shards it uses as ammunition in a more controlled and accurate burst.

WP_A_Sniper_Gauss_01.name: KARMA-1
WP_A_Sniper_Gauss_01.description: While heavy and requiring a charge-up to fire, a direct hit from will cripple if not outright kill almost any target. Audible range: 500m
WP_A_Sniper_Gauss_01.lore: The Korolev Advanced Recursive Magnetic Artillery, first prototype, is a miniaturization of the sort of weaponry more commonly found on warships, offered exclusively to the Prospectors for early testing. While no longer powerful enough to take down a spacecraft, it's more than enough to handle the threats of Fortuna III.

WP_A_Sniper_Gauss_02.name: KARMA-XT - Mk.I
WP_A_Sniper_Gauss_02.description: One of various KARMA prototypes Korolev built on Fortuna III. Features a less powerful battery than the KARMA-1 release version. Audible range: 500m
WP_A_Sniper_Gauss_02.lore: The Korolev Advanced Recursive Magnetic Artillery, first prototype, is a miniaturization of the sort of weaponry more commonly found on warships, offered exclusively to the Prospectors for early testing. While no longer powerful enough to take down a spacecraft, it's more than enough to handle the threats of Fortuna III.

WP_D_SMG_Energy_01.name: Voltaic Brute
WP_D_SMG_Energy_01.description: An SMG with high versatility in its effective range. Audible range: 350m
WP_D_SMG_Energy_01.lore: Using parts built on Prospect station with material from the surface combined with salvaged components from power tools meant to build starships, the ICA's 'Brute' more than lives up to its name.

WP_E_Launch_Nade_01.name: FF4 Detonator
WP_E_Launch_Nade_01.description: A standard grenade launcher with a high damage output; it requires skilled use to operate efficiently. , Weapons_WP_E_Launch_Nade_01_Lore,Initially intended for use by colonists to clear out vermin en masse, the Detonator's payload has been modified for larger and more dangerous targets. This one seems to be from even before the colony was founded.

Launcher_Epsilon_Grenade02.name: FF4 Detonator
Launcher_Epsilon_Grenade02.description: A standard grenade launcher with a high damage output; it requires skilled use to operate efficiently. , Weapons_Launcher_Epsilon_Grenade02_Lore,Initially intended for use by colonists to clear out vermin en masse, the Detonator's payload has been modified for larger and more dangerous targets.

WP_G_AR_Beam_01.name: Gorgon
WP_G_AR_Beam_01.description: A powerful beam rifle that needs charging up to fire. Not the easiest to handle, but lethal in proper hands. Audible range: 350m
WP_G_AR_Beam_01.lore: The Zeus' little sister, the Gorgon may not be as devastating, but its glare can leave any target petrified in place. And crispy.

WP_A_SGun_Energy_01.name: PKR Maelstrom
WP_A_SGun_Energy_01.description: A semi-automatic shotgun; heavy and a poor choice at range, but utterly devastating up close. Audible range: 350m
WP_A_SGun_Energy_01.lore: Korolev's first attempt at a building a phase weapon, the Phase-Kinetic Reactive 'Maelstrom's' ammo pack carries more than enough energy to fulminate whatever gets in its way in a matter of seconds, provided it's close enough.

WP_G_Sniper_Energy_01.name: Basilisk
WP_G_Sniper_Energy_01.description: A phase tech marksman rifle; the impacts are powerful for its class, and it boasts a high rate of fire. Audible range: 450m
WP_G_Sniper_Energy_01.lore: The result of an offshoot project during early development of the Phasic Lancer, the Basilisk trades higher ammo count for a much stronger energy discharge. While still in the prototyping, Osiris is happy to offer this rifle to Prospectors of a high enough standing.

WP_D_HVY_Exotic_01.name: HAZE
WP_D_HVY_Exotic_01.description: A slow firing launcher, projectiles create a harming energy field on impact. Further discharges of the launcher into an active field feed into it, until reaching a critical point resulting in a devastating release of energy. , Weapons_WP_D_HVY_Exotic_01_Lore,Discovered while developing an a veltecite-powered plasma cannon, High Amplitude Zender Emmissions were found to have an effect remarkably similar to the effect of the energy field known as 'The Cycle', though the decaying plasma core fueling it is much shorter lived than the anomaly surrounding Fortuna III.

WP_G_AR_Needle_01.name: Manticore
WP_G_AR_Needle_01.description: A flechette assault rifle; it's heavy hitting, but less accurate compared to similar rifles. Audible range: 400m
WP_G_AR_Needle_01.lore: Intended for use in pressurised environments, the Manticore was designed for more militaristic use than the compact ASP. Lightweight, accurate, and lethal, it's seen use by marines both performing as and defending against boarding parties.

WP_G_AR_Needle_02.name: Manticore - Mk.II
WP_G_AR_Needle_02.description: The Harbinger Expeditionary Corps. variant of the Manticore, more powerful than the civilian Manticore available for sale. Audible range: 400m
WP_G_AR_Needle_02.lore: Intended for use in pressurised environments, the Manticore was designed for more militaristic use than the compact ASP. Lightweight, accurate, and lethal, it's seen use by marines both performing as and defending against boarding parties.

WP_A_SMG_Shard_01.name: KM-9 'Scrapper'
WP_A_SMG_Shard_01.description: A rapid-firing shard SMG; a good choice for taking out targets at close range, though of little use in long range engagements. Audible range: 350m
WP_A_SMG_Shard_01.lore: Faced with an ever-increasing surplus of adrentite sludge, an inventive Korolev waste management engineer brought forth a novel way of handling the hazardous byproduct: shoot it. The 'Scrapper' was the first viable weapon produced by Korolev Munitions, one of the megacorp's many competing arms manufacturing branches, and the first known to use adrentite crystals as ammunition.

WP_E_AR_Energy_01.name: AR-55 Autorifle
WP_E_AR_Energy_01.description: A decent fully automatic rifle; doesn't excel in any one department, but it's effective and versatile. Audible range: 400m
WP_E_AR_Energy_01.lore: The AR-55 Phase Autorifle was commissioned by the IFA in an attempt to improve standard Authority armament without further increasing their reliance on Korolev Heavy Industries. While the IFA would eventually settle with the SAR-62, CoTEC's AR-55 remains a popular weapon in private armies and corporate security forces, and has succeeded at being an effective market counter to the popular KOR-47.

WP_E_AR_Energy_02.name: AR-55 Autorifle - Mk.II
WP_E_AR_Energy_02.description: A contraband version of the AR-55, originally intended for use in the Demia Rebellion. More powerful than the mass produced version CoTEC would later sell to various frontier worlds. Audible range: 400m
WP_E_AR_Energy_02.lore: The AR-55 Phase Autorifle was commissioned by the IFA in an attempt to improve standard Authority armament without further increasing their reliance on Korolev Heavy Industries. While the IFA would eventually settle with the SAR-62, CoTEC's AR-55 remains a popular weapon in private armies and corporate security forces, and has succeeded at being an effective market counter to the popular KOR-47.

WP_E_AR_Energy_01_Scrappy.name: Rusty AR-55 Autorifle
WP_E_AR_Energy_01_Scrappy.description: A rusty automatic rifle, doesn't seem to excel anymore. Audible range: 400m

WP_E_SGun_Bullet_01.name: B9 Trenchgun
WP_E_SGun_Bullet_01.description: Pump-action shotgun with high-spread and short range. Yep, it's a shotgun, all right. Audible range: 350m

WP_E_SGun_Bullet_01_Scrappy.name: Rusty B9 Trenchgun
WP_E_SGun_Bullet_01_Scrappy.description: Rusty Pump-action shotgun, high-spread, short range. Just a bit damaged. Audible range: 350m

WP_D_LMG_Energy_01.name: ICA Guarantee
WP_D_LMG_Energy_01.description: A fast firing phase LMG, perfect for pinning down targets. Audible range: 400m
WP_D_LMG_Energy_01.lore: This Fortuna III custom isn't known for its finesse, but it'll chew through any target if the user manages keep it under control. With the amount of ammo expended, you're Guaranteed to hit something!

WP_D_LMG_Energy_02.name: ICA Guarantee - Mk.I
WP_D_LMG_Energy_02.description: A less powerful version of the Guarantee, originally intended for when more conventional methods of pest control  were not enough. Audible range: 400m
WP_D_LMG_Energy_02.lore: This Fortuna III custom isn't known for its finesse, but it'll chew through any target if the user manages keep it under control. With the amount of ammo expended, you're Guaranteed to hit something!

WP_G_HVY_Beam_01_Event_01.name: Holiday Zeus Beam
WP_G_HVY_Beam_01_Event_01.description: A less powerful version of the Zeus, mass produced just in time for the holidays.  Called 'Zeus' for turning any mortal into the God of Lightning, this heavy weapon will fulminate any creature that meets your jolly ire.
WP_G_HVY_Beam_01_Event_01.lore: NOTE: This item will only be available during the holidays!

WP_D_Pistol_Bullet_01_Event_01.name: Holiday Bulldog
WP_D_Pistol_Bullet_01_Event_01.description: Not quite a snowball launcher, unless you ever played with Kevin and his iceballs.  While very very mean at close range, in its default configuration it suffers from very limited range.
WP_D_Pistol_Bullet_01_Event_01.lore: NOTE: This item will only be available during the holidays!

WP_A_Sniper_Shard_01.name: Suppressed Prototype Sniper
WP_A_Sniper_Shard_01.description: A suppressed sniper in a lightweight design firing shards allowing it to be less noticeable and easier to reposition.

Ammo_Light.name: Light ammo
Ammo_Light.description: Cheap ammo for pistols and submachine guns. Compatible weapons: K-28, S-576 PDW, Scarab, KM-9 'Scrapper'. , Ammo_Medium_Description,Standard issue assault rifle ammo. Compatible weapons: AR-55 Autorifle, Manticore.

Ammo_Heavy.name: Heavy ammo
Ammo_Heavy.description: Standard issue sniper rifle ammo. Compatible weapons: C-32 Bolt Action. , Ammo_Shotgun_Description,Standard issue shotgun ammo. Compatible weapons: B9 Trenchgun, Bulldog.

Ammo_Medium_03.name: Shard medium ammo
Ammo_Medium_03.description: Advanced ammo for assault rifles and light machine guns. Compatible weapons: ICA Guarantee, Phasic Lancer. , Ammo_Heavy_03_Description,Advanced ammo for sniper and designated marksman rifles. Compatible weapons: Lacerator, KBR-Longshot.

Ammo_Shotgun_03.name: Shard shotgun ammo
Ammo_Shotgun_03.description: Advanced shotgun ammo. Compatible weapons: PKR Maelstrom, Shattergun. , Ammo_Light_04_Description,Ultimate ammo for pistols and submachine guns. Compatible weapons: Asp Flechette Gun, Hammer, Voltaic Brute.

Ammo_Medium_04.name: Impact medium ammo
Ammo_Medium_04.description: Ultimate assault rifle ammo. Compatible weapons: Advocate, Gorgon, KOR-47. , Ammo_Heavy_05_Description,Ultimate ammo for sniper and designated marksman rifles. Compatible weapons: Basilisk, Kinetic Arbiter, KARMA-1.

Ammo_Special_06_1.name: KOMRAD cartridge
Ammo_Special_06_1.description: Specialist ammo for KOMRAD grenade launcher.

Ammo_Special_06_2.name: ZEUS cartridge
Ammo_Special_06_2.description: Specialist ammo for ZEUS beam LMG.

Ammo_Derelict.name: Derelict ammo
Ammo_Derelict.description: Rusty old times ammo cartridge. It is safe to sell it or throw it away.

TOOL_MineralScanner_01.name: Scanner
TOOL_MineralScanner_01.description: A versatile scanning device connected to the user's HUD that renders the outline of nearby obstacles and solid objects, even in low visibility situations (such as darkness, fog, or smoke).   By default, it's also able to accurately detect Nickel deposits, but can be modified with special attachments to detect various other valuable mineral types found on the surface.

TOOL_AdvancedMineralScanner.name: Advanced Scanner
TOOL_AdvancedMineralScanner.description: A more advanced Korolev version of the common scanning device that is able to detect any form of valuable minerals.

TOOL_Pickaxe_01.name: Pickaxe
TOOL_Pickaxe_01.description: A Prospector's trusty pickaxe, used to tear valuable minerals from veins and deposits on Fortuna III.

TOOL_Mining_01.name: Heavy Mining Tool
TOOL_Mining_01.description: An experimental automatic Mining tool designed by Korolev to allow for more efficient extraction of Minerals from Fortuna III.

TOOL_Binocular_Basic_01.name: Binocular
TOOL_Binocular_Basic_01.description: Used to look at things at a distance

TOOL_MessaggePost_01.name: MessagePost
TOOL_MessaggePost_01.description: Used to create Message Post, Weapons_TOOL_MessaggePost_01_Lore, Message Post are easy to create in the future.

TOOL_FlareGun_01.name: Flare Gun
TOOL_FlareGun_01.description: Used to create Flares, Weapons_TOOL_FlareGun_01_Lore, Flares are easy to create in the future.

TOOL_Stormbrella_01.name: Stormbrella
TOOL_Stormbrella_01.description: When active attracts and protects from Lightning strikes during the Storm, Weapons_TOOL_Stormbrella_01_Lore, Those lightning strikes can be deadly...

TOOL_ThrowableStormProtection_01.name: Throwable Storm Protection
TOOL_ThrowableStormProtection_01.description: Its a storm protection thingy!, Weapons_TOOL_ThrowableStormProtection_01_Lore, How handy during Storms.

TOOL_Transponder_01.name: Transponder
TOOL_Transponder_01.description: Transponder to transpond transpondy-thingies, Weapons_TOOL_Transponder_01_Lore, Friend?

TOOL_PlaceableLight_01.name: Placeable Light
TOOL_PlaceableLight_01.description: Its a light!, Weapons_TOOL_PlaceableLight_01_Lore, This time you place it!

TOOL_PlaceableStormProtection_01.name: Placeable Storm Protection
TOOL_PlaceableStormProtection_01.description: Its a storm protection thingy!, Weapons_TOOL_PlaceableStormProtection_01_Lore, This time you place it!
